title: Strucutral and Functional Enrichment Analyses
text: Structural functional enrichment metabolomics data.

title: Strucutral and Functional Enrichment Analyses
text: riches package can installed GitHub using:

title: Strucutral and Functional Enrichment Analyses
text: package documentation can browsed online https://jasenfinch.github.io/riches/. believe ’ve found bug riches, please file bug (, possible, reproducible example) https://github.com/jasenfinch/riches/issues.

title: Example analysis data — assigned_data
text: Example analysis data

title: Example analysis data — assigned_data
text: S4 object class AnalysisData metabolyseR package.

title: Example analysis data — assigned_data
text: Example analysis data based Brachypodium distachyon ecotype comparison FIE-MS metabolomic fingerprinting data set available metaboData package. features include putative molecular formula assignments.

title: Available functional enrichment methods — availableMethods
text: Methods available functional enrichment using FELLA package

title: Available functional enrichment methods — availableMethods
text: character vector available methods.

title: FunctionalEnrichment S4 class accessors — hits
text: Accessor methods FunctionalEnrichment S4 class.

title: FunctionalEnrichment S4 class accessors — hits
code: hits(x)  # S4 method for FunctionalEnrichment hits(x)  # S4 method for FunctionalEnrichment explanatoryFeatures(x)  enrichmentResults(x)  # S4 method for FunctionalEnrichment enrichmentResults(x)  generateResultsTable(x, method = availableMethods(), nlimit = 250, ...)  # S4 method for FunctionalEnrichment generateResultsTable(x, method = availableMethods(), nlimit = 250)

title: FunctionalEnrichment S4 class accessors — hits
text: x object S4 class FunctionalEnrichment method method results access. One availableMethods. nlimit argument pass argument nlimit FELLA::generateResultsTable. Limits order sub-graph solutions methods diffusion pagerank. ... ignored

title: FunctionalEnrichment S4 class accessors — hits
text: tibble list objects FELLA.USER S4 class depending method used.

title: FunctionalEnrichment S4 class accessors — hits
code: ## Perform random forest on the example data  random_forest <- assigned_data %>%  metabolyseR::randomForest(   cls = 'class' )  ## Perform functional enrichment analysis enrichment_results <- functionalEnrichment(   random_forest,   'bdi',   methods = 'hypergeom',   organism_data = organismData(     'bdi',     database_directory = system.file(       'bdi',       package = 'riches'),     internal_directory = FALSE   ) ) #> Loading KEGG graph data... #> Done. #> Loading hypergeom data... #> Loading matrix... #> Done. #> Loading diffusion data... #> Loading matrix... #> 'diffusion.matrix.RData' not present in:/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/riches/bdi/diffusion.matrix.RData. Simulated permutations may execute slower for diffusion. #> Done. #> Loading rowSums... #> 'diffusion.rowSums.RData' not present in:/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/riches/bdi/diffusion.rowSums.RData. Z-scores won't be available for diffusion. #> Done. #> Loading pagerank data... #> Loading matrix... #> 'pagerank.matrix.RData' not present in:/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/riches/bdi/pagerank.matrix.RData. Simulated permutations may execute slower for pagerank. #> Done. #> Loading rowSums... #> 'pagerank.rowSums.RData' not present in:/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/riches/bdi/pagerank.rowSums.RData. Z-scores won't be available for pagerank. #> Done. #> Data successfully loaded. #>  #> class #> ABR1~ABR5~ABR6~BD21 #> Running hypergeom... #> Starting hypergeometric p-values calculation... #> Done.  ## Access the m/z feature KEGG compound matches hits(enrichment_results) #> # A tibble: 332 × 8 #>    ID     MF     INCHI                      SMILES name  feature adduct compound #>    <chr>  <chr>  <chr>                      <chr>  <chr> <chr>   <chr>  <chr>    #>  1 C01546 C5H4O3 InChI=1S/C5H4O3/c6-5(7)4-… "c1cc… n111… n111.0… [M-H]… 2-Furoa… #>  2 C01546 C5H4O3 InChI=1S/C5H4O3/c6-5(7)4-… "c1cc… n112… n112.0… [M-H]… 2-Furoa… #>  3 C00122 C4H4O4 InChI=1S/C4H4O4/c5-3(6)1-… "C(=C… n115… n115.0… [M-H]… Fumarate #>  4 C01384 C4H4O4 InChI=1S/C4H4O4/c5-3(6)1-… "C(=C… n115… n115.0… [M-H]… Maleic … #>  5 C00122 C4H4O4 InChI=1S/C4H4O4/c5-3(6)1-… "C(=C… n116… n116.0… [M-H]… Fumarate #>  6 C01384 C4H4O4 InChI=1S/C4H4O4/c5-3(6)1-… "C(=C… n116… n116.0… [M-H]… Maleic … #>  7 C00122 C4H4O4 InChI=1S/C4H4O4/c5-3(6)1-… "C(=C… n117… n117.0… [M-H]… Fumarate #>  8 C01384 C4H4O4 InChI=1S/C4H4O4/c5-3(6)1-… "C(=C… n117… n117.0… [M-H]… Maleic … #>  9 C00042 C4H6O4 InChI=1S/C4H6O4/c5-3(6)1-… "C(CC… n117… n117.0… [M-H]… Succina… #> 10 C02170 C4H6O4 InChI=1S/C4H6O4/c1-2(3(5)… "CC(C… n117… n117.0… [M-H]… Methylm… #> # ℹ 322 more rows  ## Access the explanatory features used for functional enrichment explanatoryFeatures(enrichment_results) #> # A tibble: 153 × 5 #> # Groups:   response, comparison [1] #>    response comparison          feature                        metric      value #>    <chr>    <chr>               <chr>                          <chr>       <dbl> #>  1 class    ABR1~ABR5~ABR6~BD21 n267.05255 C12H12O7  [M-H]1-   false_p… 5.13e-17 #>  2 class    ABR1~ABR5~ABR6~BD21 p130.04956                     false_p… 1.92e-13 #>  3 class    ABR1~ABR5~ABR6~BD21 n176.93581 CH3O6P  [M+Cl]1-    false_p… 2.65e-12 #>  4 class    ABR1~ABR5~ABR6~BD21 n295.10519                     false_p… 2.65e-12 #>  5 class    ABR1~ABR5~ABR6~BD21 n371.10074                     false_p… 2.65e-12 #>  6 class    ABR1~ABR5~ABR6~BD21 n447.09634 C18H24O11S  [M-H]1- false_p… 3.43e-11 #>  7 class    ABR1~ABR5~ABR6~BD21 n385.11682                     false_p… 4.15e-10 #>  8 class    ABR1~ABR5~ABR6~BD21 n439.08383 C26H16O7  [M-H]1-   false_p… 4.15e-10 #>  9 class    ABR1~ABR5~ABR6~BD21 n88.98757 C2H2O4  [M-H]1-      false_p… 4.15e-10 #> 10 class    ABR1~ABR5~ABR6~BD21 n101.02399                     false_p… 4.66e- 9 #> # ℹ 143 more rows  ## Access the FELLA.USER functional enrichment object enrichmentResults(enrichment_results) #> $`class_ABR1~ABR5~ABR6~BD21` #> Compounds in the input: 41 #>  [1] "C00042" "C02170" "C00009" "C01620" "C01454" "C03765" "C06224" "C07085" #>  [9] "C07086" "C07211" "C07215" "C10700" "C00168" "C00383" "C01146" "C09315" #> [17] "C00493" "C04236" "C16588" "C17696" "C01179" "C01197" "C05350" "C12623" #> [25] "C00257" "C00514" "C00800" "C00817" "C00880" "C15930" "C05533" "C01750" #> [33] "C03951" "C12249" "C12626" "C16409" "C00209" "C03758" "C16666" "C06181" #> [41] "C21525" #> Background compounds: 117 #> ----------------------------- #> Hypergeometric test: ready. #> Top 15 p-values: #> bdi00010 bdi00020 bdi00030 bdi00040 bdi00051 bdi00052 bdi00053 bdi00061  #>        1        1        1        1        1        1        1        1  #> bdi00062 bdi00071 bdi00073 bdi00100 bdi00130 bdi00190 bdi00195  #>        1        1        1        1        1        1        1  #>  #> ----------------------------- #> Heat diffusion: not performed #> ----------------------------- #> PageRank: not performed  ## Extract a table of enrichment results generateResultsTable(enrichment_results) #> Writing hypergeom results... #> No pathway is below the p-value threshold. #> # A tibble: 0 × 1 #> # ℹ 1 variable: comparison <chr>

title: Functional enrichment — functionalEnrichment
text: Perform functional enrichment analyses explanatory features using FELLA R package.

title: Functional enrichment — functionalEnrichment
code: functionalEnrichment(   x,   organism,   methods = availableMethods(),   split = c("none", "trends"),   organism_data = organismData(organism),   adduct_rules_table = adduct_rules(),   ... )  # S4 method for RandomForest functionalEnrichment(   x,   organism,   methods = availableMethods(),   split = c("none", "trends"),   organism_data = organismData(organism),   adduct_rules_table = adduct_rules(),   ... )

title: Functional enrichment — functionalEnrichment
text: x object S4 class RandomForest organism KEGG code organism interest methods enrichment techniques build. returned availableMethods. split split explanatory features groups based trends. See details. organism_data object S4 class FELLA.DATA adduct_rules_table adduct ionisation rules matching m/z features KEGG compounds. Format returned mzAnnotation::adduct_rules. ... arguments pass metabolyseR::explanatoryFeatures

title: Functional enrichment — functionalEnrichment
text: object S4 class FunctionalEnrichment.

title: Functional enrichment — functionalEnrichment
text: argument split = 'trends', explanatory features can split groups based trends. supported unsupervised random forest. random forest classification, binary comparisons . Functional enrichment performed seperately regulated explanatory features comparison. regulated regulated groups based trends log2 ratios comparison classes. regulated explanatory features higher median intensity right-hand class compared left-hand class comparison. opposite true regulated explanatory features. random forest regression, explanatory features split based Spearman's correlation coefficient response variable prior functional enrichment analysis giving positively correlated negatively correlated subgroups.

title: Organism data — organismData
text: Load build organism specific KEGG datafor enrichment analysis. provides convenience wrapper around FELLA::loadKEGGdata, FELLA::buildGraphFromKEGGREST FELLA::buildDataFromGraph. See documentation functions information.

title: Organism data — organismData
code: organismData(   organism,   methods = availableMethods(),   filter_path = NULL,   database_directory = organism,   internal_directory = TRUE,   damping_factor = 0.85,   niter = 100 )

title: Organism data — organismData
text: organism KEGG code organism interest methods enrichment techniques build. returned availableMethods. filter_path argument pass argument filter.path FELLA::buildGraphFromKEGGREST. vector regular expressions match pathways exclude. database_directory argument pass argument databaseDir FELLA::buildDataFromGraph FELLA::loadKEGGdata. directory name/path save KEGG data. internal_directory logical. Argument pass argument internalDir FELLA::buildDataFromGraph FELLA::loadKEGGdata. save directory internal FELLA package directory? damping_factor argument pass argument dampingFactor FELLA::buildDataFromGraph. value 0 1 PageRank damping factor. niter argument pass argument niter FELLA::buildDataFromGraph. value 10 1000. number iterations estimate values CC size.

title: Organism data — organismData
text: object S4 class FELLA.DATA containing KEGG data specified organism.

title: StructuralEnrichment S4 class accessors — structuralClassifications
code: structuralClassifications(x)  # S4 method for StructuralEnrichment structuralClassifications(x)  # S4 method for StructuralEnrichment explanatoryFeatures(x)  # S4 method for StructuralEnrichment enrichmentResults(x)

title: StructuralEnrichment S4 class accessors — structuralClassifications
code: ## Perform random forest on the example data  random_forest <- assigned_data %>%    metabolyseR::randomForest(     cls = 'class'   )  ## Perform functional enrichment analysis enrichment_results <- structuralEnrichment(   random_forest,   structural_classifications )  ## title: Structural enrichment — structuralEnrichment
text: Perform structural enrichment using -representation analysis explanatory m/z features random forest.

title: Structural enrichment — structuralEnrichment
code: structuralEnrichment(   x,   structural_classifications,   p_adjust_method = "bonferroni",   split = c("none", "trends"),   ... )  # S4 method for RandomForest,tbl_df structuralEnrichment(   x,   structural_classifications,   p_adjust_method = "bonferroni",   split = c("none", "trends"),   ... )  # S4 method for RandomForest,Construction structuralEnrichment(   x,   structural_classifications,   p_adjust_method = "bonferroni",   split = c("none", "trends"),   ... )

title: Structural enrichment — structuralEnrichment
text: x object S4 class RandomForest structural_classifications structral classifications corresponding m/z features present object specified argument x. either tibble returned construction::classifications() object S4 class Construction. p_adjust_method p-value adjustment method. One returned p.adjust.methods. split split explanatory features groups based trends. See details. ... arguments pass metabolyseR::explanatoryFeatures()

title: Structural enrichment — structuralEnrichment
text: object S4 class StructuralEnrichment.

title: Structural enrichment — structuralEnrichment
text: -representation analysis performed explanatory m/z features structural class within experimental class comparison using Fisher's Exact Test. argument split = 'trends', explanatory features can split groups based trends. supported unsupervised random forest. random forest classification, binary comparisons . Functional enrichment performed seperately regulated explanatory features comparison. regulated regulated groups based trends log2 ratios comparison classes. regulated explanatory features higher median intensity right-hand class compared left-hand class comparison. opposite true regulated explanatory features. random forest regression, explanatory features split based Spearman's correlation coefficient response variable prior functional enrichment analysis giving positively correlated negatively correlated subgroups.

title: Structural enrichment — structuralEnrichment
code: ## Perform random forest on the example data  random_forest <- assigned_data %>%    metabolyseR::randomForest(     cls = 'class'   )  ## Perform structural enrichment analysis using the example structural classifications structuralEnrichment(   random_forest,   structural_classifications ) #>  #> Random forest classification  #>  #> Samples:	 60  #> Features:	 1706  #> Response:	 class  #> # comparisons:	 1  #>  #> 153 explanatory m/z features. #> 88 structural classes total. #> 5 significantly enriched structural classes.  ## An example using split trends ## Perform random forest on the example data  random_forest <- assigned_data %>%    metabolyseR::randomForest(     cls = 'class',     binary = TRUE   )  ## Perform structural enrichment analysis using the example structural classifications structuralEnrichment(   random_forest,   structural_classifications,   split = 'trends' ) #>  #> Random forest classification  #>  #> Samples:	 60  #> Features:	 1706  #> Response:	 class  #> # comparisons:	 6  #>  #> 443 explanatory m/z features. #> 88 structural classes total. #> 75 significantly enriched structural classes.

title: Example structural classifications — structural_classifications
text: Example structural classifications

title: Example structural classifications — structural_classifications
text: tibble containing consensus structural classifications m/z features found assigned_data example data set.

title: Example structural classifications — structural_classifications
text: example consensus structural classifications generated using construction package (v0.3.0) based example analysis data (assigned_data) based Brachypodium distachyon ecotype comparison FIE-MS metabolomic fingerprinting data set available metaboData package.

title: riches 0.3.0
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Replaced example data set molecular formula assigned AnalysisData class object. Added functionalEnrichment() method RandomForest S4 class. Removed EnrichmentParameters S4 class associated methods. Added example organism FELLA data Brachypodium distachyon (bdi). Added organismData() function convenience wrapper loading building KEGG graph data FELLA enrichment analyses. Added accessor methods FunctionalEnrichment S4 class. Added example structural classifications. Added structuralEnrichment() method RandomForest S4 class. Functional structural enrichment analyses can now performed explanatory features split feature trends binary comparisons regression using split argument functionEnrichment() structuralEnrichment().
